task_summary: Perceive the milk box, align to it, and move it on the tabletop via a short push, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm operates over a white tabletop with several small items. The target is a white rectangular milk box placed near the center-right among bottles and cans. The behavior first detects the carton, aligns the end-effector, opens the gripper to avoid grasping, and executes a controlled surface push to translate the box laterally. After the motion, the robot pauses briefly and retreats to clear the scene. The frames suggest a push-based translation rather than a lift-and-place.
preconditions: Workspace is free of obstacles along the planned push path
Milk box is on a flat, pushable surface
Gripper operational and can open to non-contact width
stepwise_plan: Detect the milk box on the table
Approach and align with a small Cartesian tolerance
Open gripper to avoid grasping contact
Push the milk box a short distance along the table
Retreat the end-effector from the object
success_criteria: Milk box translated by roughly the commanded push distance
No topple or collision with neighboring objects
End-effector cleared from object and returned to a safe offset
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected -> re-detect or scan the scene
Poor alignment causes slip -> re-align with tighter tolerance
Unexpected contact -> stop, retreat, and re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the retreat completes after a successful push or after a recoverable failure times out.

frame_4.now_evidence: Clear start of the push with tool contacting the milk box and lateral motion visible.
frame_4.predicts_next: Continued translation of the carton across the surface is expected.

node_specs.description: Detect the milk box on the table.
Approach and align to the carton with small tolerance.
Open gripper to avoid grasping during push.
Push the milk box along the surface by a short distance.
Back away to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or glare
Misalignment causing side slip or rotation of the box
Insufficient push distance due to friction
recovery_strategy: Reduce speed (via larger timeout) and repeat push
assumptions: The 'milk box' corresponds to the white rectangular carton near center-right in the frames.
Direction of motion is lateral to the right, inferred from arm motion; instruction did not specify direction.
Task interpreted as surface push (move) rather than pick-and-place, matching the frames.
